issues: The use of bullet points under Preparatory Cycle is inconsistent with the rest of the CV.
Section titles could be more visually distinct (e.g., bolder, larger font).
suggestions: Use consistent bullet point formatting throughout the document.
Standardize the date formatting (e.g., MM/YYYY - MM/YYYY or YYYY - YYYY).
Increase the font size and/or boldness of section titles to improve readability.

strengths: Demonstrates technical skills relevant to software development, including Python, SQL, and JavaScript.
Highlights project experience with the IndabaX website, showcasing web development skills.
Includes participation in hackathons, demonstrating problem-solving and teamwork abilities.
weaknesses: Lacks specific examples of server-side development experience directly relevant to the job description (e.g., Node.js, Django/Flask backend project).
The 'Machine Learning (Beginner)' and 'Deep Learning (Beginner)' tags, while relevant, are not as strong as server-side experience in the context of the job description.
The description of the projects doesn't quantify achievements or provide concrete results.
suggestions: Add a project or experience specifically showcasing server-side development, focusing on technologies like Node.js, Flask (with mention of API implementation), or similar.
Quantify the impact of the IndabaX website project (e.g., number of users, improved website traffic, SEO ranking improvements).
Expand on the NLP hackathon project, detailing the specific problem solved, technologies used, and the individual contribution of Anas.

general.summary: The CV demonstrates a good foundation in programming and web development. However, it needs to be tailored to the server-side development job description by highlighting relevant experience and skills and providing more specific examples and quantifiable results.
top_priorities: Showcase server-side development experience with a project (personal, academic, or open-source).
Quantify achievements and provide concrete results for existing projects.
Expand on the NLP hackathon project description to highlight skills relevant to API development.
